Class ContainerCreator

java.lang.Object
com.github.cowwoc.docker.resource.ContainerCreator
public final class ContainerCreator extends Object
Creates a container.

      this

    • bind

      public ContainerCreator bind(Path hostPath, String containerPath, ContainerCreator.BindMountOptions... options)
      Binds a path from the host to the container. Any modification applied on either end is mirrored to the other.
      Parameters:
      hostPath - a path on the host
      containerPath - a path on the container
      options - mounting options
      Returns:
      this
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any of the arguments are null
      IllegalArgumentException - if:
      • hostPath or containerPath contain leading or trailing whitespace or are empty.
      • containerPath is not an absolute path.

    • autoRemove

      public ContainerCreator autoRemove(boolean autoRemove)
      Determines whether the container should be automatically removed on exit.
      Parameters:
      autoRemove - true to remove on exit
      Returns:
      this
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if restartPolicy is enabled

    • doNotRestart

      public ContainerCreator doNotRestart()
      Configures the container to never restart.
      Returns:
      this
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - autoRemove is true

    • alwaysRestart

      public ContainerCreator alwaysRestart()
      Configures the container to always restart.
      Returns:
      this
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - autoRemove is true

    • restartUnlessStopped

      public ContainerCreator restartUnlessStopped()
      Configures the container to restart unless it is manually stopped.
      Returns:
      this
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - autoRemove is true

    • restartOnFailure

      public ContainerCreator restartOnFailure(int maximumRetryCount)
      Configures the container to restart if its exit code is non-zero.
      Parameters:
      maximumRetryCount - the number of times to retry before giving up
      Returns:
      this
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if:
      • autoRemove is true.
      • maximumRetryCount is negative.

    • create

      public ContainerCreator.CreateResult create() throws IOException, TimeoutException, InterruptedException
      Creates the container.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the client is closed
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the request times out before receiving a response. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.
